case_vignette: A 22-year-old woman complains of an itchy rash on her leg for 4 weeks! She is a collegiate swimmer and had a prior ringworm infection during her freshman year! She has been using over-the-counter antifungal cream for the past 3 weeks with no relief! Multiple round, erythematous, scaling lesions are present on her right leg, some of which are vesicular and weeping! Potassium hydroxide (KOH) test is negative for a dermatophytic infection!
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have an itchy rash on my leg that has been there for about 4 weeks.
Is the rash localized to one area or has it spread to other parts of your body as well?
The rash is localized to my right leg.
Have you noticed any changes in the color or texture of the rash over the past 4 weeks?
Yes, the rash has multiple round, red, scaly lesions and some of them are blister-like and oozing.
Do you have any known allergies or have you come into contact with any new substances, plants, or animals recently?
No, I haven't come into contact with any new substances, plants, or animals recently.
Have you tried any treatments or medications for the rash so far? If yes, what were they and did they help?
I have been using over-the-counter antifungal cream for the past 3 weeks, but it hasn't provided any relief.
Do you have a history of eczema, psoriasis, or similar skin conditions personally or in your family?
No, I do not have a personal or family history of eczema, psoriasis, or similar skin conditions.
Final Diagnosis: Contact Dermatitis

Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have an itchy rash on my leg that has been there for about 4 weeks.
Has the rash spread to other parts of your body?
No, the rash is only on my right leg.
Does the rash have any distinct features such as blisters, scales, or a particular pattern?
Yes, the rash has round, red, scaly lesions, and some have blisters that are weeping.
Do you have a history of allergies or any new products, like soaps or lotions, that you started using recently?
No, I don't have a history of allergies and haven't started using any new products recently.
Have you been in contact with any natural environments recently, like woods or parks, where you might have been exposed to plants or insects?
No, I haven't been in contact with any natural environments like woods or parks recently.
Do you have any known medical conditions or are you currently on any medication?
No, I don't have any known medical conditions and I'm not currently taking any medication.
Have you had similar symptoms in the past?
Yes, I had a ringworm infection on my leg during my freshman year.
**Final Diagnosis:** Ringworm (Tinea corporis)
